meanings.definition: Extending far down from the top or surface.
meanings.sent1: The cave was dark and deeps, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent2: The well was so deeps that no one could see the bottom.
meanings.sent3: The mystery of the deeps cave kept the explorers guessing.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a deeps sadness that no one could understand.
meanings.sent5: The deeps ocean floor was a hidden world waiting to be explored.

meanings.sent1: The sailors gazed at the deeps, endless ocean before them.
meanings.sent2: The deeps of the lake shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman's tale of the deeps sea monster amused the children.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes reflected the deeps of the ocean's beauty.
meanings.sent5: The deeps of the ocean held secrets yet to be discovered.

meanings.definition: The most intense or extreme part.
meanings.sent1: In the deeps of winter, the snowfall was heavy and constant.
meanings.sent2: The deeps of the storm brought strong winds and heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The deeps of the competition made everyone nervous.
meanings.sent4: The deeps of her emotions were hard to understand.
meanings.sent5: The deeps of the night enveloped everything in darkness.
